revisions.rev:
The '''CimetiÃ¨re de Pantin''' in the town of [[Pantin]] in the suburbs of [[Paris]], [[France]] opened on November 15, 1886 and is the largest cemetery in the city, occupying 1.07 kmÂ². Located in the north-eastern section of the city, Pantin is a garden style burial grounds with more than 8,000 trees and streets that allow access by motor vehicles. It is one of the least known of the many famous Parisian cemeteries.
==Notable interments==
*[[Jeanne Aubert]] (1906-1988), actress *[[Jacques Audiberti]] (1899-1965), writer *[[Marie-Louise Damien|Damia]] (1892-1978), singer *[[Fratellini family|Fratellini family members]], circus family *[[FrÃ©hel]] (1891-1951), singer *[[Alphonse Halimi]] (1932-2006), boxer *[[Helno]] (1963-1993), singer *[[VÃ©ra KorÃ¨ne]] (1901-1996), Russian-born actress *[[Ginette Leclerc]] (1912-1991), actress *[[Jean-Pierre Melville]] (1917-1973), film director/producer, Resistance fighter *[[La Goulue]] (1866-1929), [[Cancan]] dancer (original burial site) *[[Jules VÃ©drines]] (1881-1919), aviator *[[Jean d'Yd]] (1880-1964), actor
